title: Australian aborigines: police tracker (A)
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Crime, Espionage, Justice, Police & Prisons/Police - Australia
Crime, Espionage, Justice, Police & Prisons/Tracking and trailing
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Aboriginal Australians - Economic conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Country life - Australia
description: Episode number 15 of Series "Modern social studies". Explains how Jackie the full blooded aboriginal police tracker from Katherine learnt this skill, which enables the aboriginal to hunt and the police to keep law and order and to save lives in Australia's outback. Taken during the University of Sydney's 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land and produced in collaboration with Professor A.P. Elkin, Professor of Anthropology, University of Sydney.
